conbody.p: Nokia recommends to enable multi-queue functionality in your NCC CNF deployment because it increases your operational efficiency.

For example, in OpenStack environment the virtio-net multi-queue allows to scale the network performance with increased number of vCPUs by letting them transfer packets through more than one virtqueue pair at a time. To allow the virtio-net multi-queue functionality, this functionality has to be configured for all the QCOW2 images when you create them in OpenStack by entering: --property hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=true.
conbody.codeblock: S glance image-create --name <NCC CNF image> \ --disk-format qcow2 \ --file <NCC CNF image>.qcow2 \ --container-format bare --property hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=true
conbody.p: In NCC CNF, the multi-queue NCC setting allows to configure the virtio-net multi-queue functionality in OpenStack. When localization is established at startup, the multi-queue setting is attempted to configure. If OpenStack configuration is overcommitted for CPU and RAM, the VMs might use the lesser value than specified by NCC.

li.p: The multi-queue NCC setting must be enabled for all CNFs in the deployment.
The multi-queue NCC setting is used only if you added --property hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=true when you created images in OpenStack.
